==Other gliding airliners==
==Other gliding airliners==
â
*[[US Airways]] [[US Airways Flight 1549|Flight 1549]] â 15 January 2009, made an emergency landing in the [[Hudson River]] after losing power in both engines, caused by multiple bird strike.
+
{{main|List of airline flights that required gliding}}
â
*[[British Airways]] [[British Airways Flight 38|Flight 38]] â 17 January 2008, crash-landed with extremely reduced power after ice crystals in the fuel clogged the fuel-oil heat exchanger (FOHE) of each engine.
  â
*[[TunisAir Express|Tuninter Airlines]] [[Tuninter Flight 1153|Flight 1153]] - 6 August 2005, made an emergency landing in the [[Mediterranean Sea]] after running out of fuel.
  â
*[[Air Transat]] [[Air Transat Flight 236|Flight 236]] â 24 August 2001, made an emergency landing in the [[Azores]] without fuel following an undetected fuel line rupture.
  â
*[[Hapag-Lloyd Airlines|Hapag-Lloyd]] [[Hapag-Lloyd Flight 3378|Flight 3378]] â 7 July 2000, landed in a powerless glide {{convert|500|m|mi}} short of the runway in [[Vienna, Austria]], with all aboard surviving.
  â
*[[Scandinavian Airlines]] [[Scandinavian Airlines Flight 751|Flight 751]] â 27 December 1991, made an emergency landing after losing power on both engines due to ice ingestion.
  â
*[[TACA Airlines|TACA]] [[TACA Flight 110|Flight 110]] â 24 May 1988, made an emergency landing after losing all power because of water ingestion to the engines.
  â
*The [[Gimli Glider]] ([[Air Canada]] Flight 143) â 23 July 1983, ran out of fuel between [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]] and [[Edmonton]], [[Alberta]], landing in [[Manitoba]].
  â
*[[Southern Airways]] [[Southern Airways Flight 242|Flight 242]] â 4 April 1977, made an emergency landing on a highway after losing all power because of water and [[hail]] ingestion to the engines.
